article.description: Jaylen Bland had 18 points, Secean Johnson added 14 and UC Riverside beat Northern Colorado 77-66 on Thursday night.
article.headline: UC Riverside coasts to 77-66 win over Northern Colorado
article.linkText: UC Riverside coasts to 77-66 win over Northern Colorado
article.story: RIVERSIDE, Calif. -- Jaylen Bland had 18 points, Secean Johnson added 14 and UC Riverside beat Northern Colorado 77-66 on Thursday night. Taylor Johns scored 13 and Robert Boezeman 12 for Riverside (5-2), which used a 23-4 run to build a 48-25 advantage at halftime. Northern Colorado (1-6) chipped away at the deficit early in the second half before the Highlanders had their largest lead at 69-41. Jordan Davis had 16 of his career-high 22 points in the second half and Jordan Wilson added 18 of his 20 after the break for Northern Colorado. They scored 22 during the Bears' 25-8 run to close the game but they were unable to narrow the gap quickly enough to pose a threat and lost their fifth straight. The Highlanders are off to their best seven-game start in the program's Division I history which started in the 2001-02 season.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
